algorithm_technique: Use a hashmap (Counter) to store frequencies of numbers and find complements.
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum number of pairs in an array that sum up to k.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through nums. For each number x, check if k-x exists in the hashmap. If so, decrement its count and increment the result.
key_insights: A hashmap (Counter) is ideal for efficiently checking the existence and frequency of complementary numbers (k-x).
The greedy approach of processing numbers as they appear and immediately forming pairs is optimal.
By decrementing the count of the complement, we ensure each number is used at most once.
